IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: To fight redlining and institutionalized discrimination through diverse communities assets and strengths.
IRS990.MissionDesc: The Greenlining Institute works to bring the American Dream within reach of all, regardless of race or income. In a nation where people of color will make up the majority of our population by 2043, America will prosper only if communities of color prosper.
IRS990.Desc: Leadership Academy - The Greenlining Academy works to empower and develop the next generation of multi-ethnic leaders to advance racial and economic equity and create positive social change. We seek to develop a network of visionary leaders ready to work across racial and ethnic lines to address America's most pressing problems and develop sustainable solutions rooted in equity and justice.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: Energy/Telecom - Works to make sure that people at all income levels have access to affordable electric, gas, and information and communications technology services.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: TCE Health Equity - Greenlining is placing six Health Equity Fellows within The California Endowment's philanthropic programs to address community health disparities in California.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: Economic Equity (BIMP) - empowering communities of color through homeownership, minority-owned businesses, financial industry and regulatory accountability to ensure that public and private policies allow all communities to realize their full economic potential.Health - brings the voices of communities of color into critical decisions that effect all of our lives and health. Greenlining efforts in this area include health care reform, insurer accountability, and health industry diversity.Green Assets - brings streams of revenue to build assets in our disenfranchised communities.Claiming Our Democracy (COD)- To do this well, the voices and experiences of communities of color must be able to inform the dialogue. Greenlining works to make government more effective by bringing the voices of communities of color into the democratic process.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Greenlining is exempt from taxation under Internal Revenue Code Section 501(c)(3) and California Revenue and Taxation Code Section 23701d Generally accepted accounting principles accounting and disclosure guidance about positions taken by an organization in its tax returns that might be uncertain. Management has considered its tax positions and believes that all of the positions taken by Greenlining in their federal and state exempt organization tax returns are more likely than not to be sustained upon examination. Greelining's returns are subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities, generally for three and four years, respectively, after they are filed.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Form 990 is reviewed at board meetings by the full board and is formally accepted by vote prior to filing.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Officers and top management employees are required to fill out a conflict of interest checklist on an annual basis. Conflicts are monitored and discussed by executive management and documented accordingly.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A review of non profit Executive Director's salaries in similar fields is conducted on an annual basis and used to determine executive management salaries. All other organization officers and/or key employees compensation is determined by the same process as the Executive Director.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Other fees: Program service expenses 428,786. Management and general expenses 93,157. Fundraising expenses 0. Total expenses 521,943.
